intro: Fagraea peregrina, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a gelatinous pulp. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
